name: Ruta graveolens
Relationship: Compare: RATANHIA; CARDUUS. Rectal (irritation); JABORANDI; PHYT.; RHUS; SIL.; ARN.Antidote: CAMPH.Complementary: CALC. PHOS.

Eyes: EYES RED, HOT, AND PAINFUL FROM SEWING OR READING FINE PRINT
Respiratory: Cough with copious, thick, yellow expectoration; chest feels weak
Painful spot on sternum; short breath with tightness of chest
Stomach: Pressure in neck of bladder after urinating; painful closure
Constant urging to urinate, feels bladder full
Back: Pain in nape, back and loins
Backache better pressure and lying on back
Head: Pain as from a nail; after excessive intoxicating drinks
Periosteum sore
Epistaxis
Rectum: DIFFICULT FECES, evacuated only with straining
Constipation, alternating with mucous, frothy stools; discharge of blood with stool
When sitting, tearing stitches in rectum
PROLAPSUS ANI every time the bowels move, after confinement
Extremities: Small of back and loins pain
Legs give out on rising from a chair, hips and thighs so weak
Pain and stiffness in wrists and hands
Sciatica; worse, lying down at night; pain from back down hips and thighs
THIGHS PAIN WHEN STRETCHING THE LIMBS
Pain in bones of feet and ankles

details: Acts upon the periosteum and cartilage, eyes and uterus. Complaints from straining FLEXOR TENDONS especially. Tendency to the formation of deposits in the periosteum, tendons, and about joints, especially wrist. Over strain of ocular muscles. All parts of the body are painful, AS IF BRUISED. Sprains (after ARNICA). Lameness after sprains. Jaundice. FEELING OF INTENSE LASSITUDE, WEAKNESS AND DESPAIR. Injured "bruised" bones.
dosage: First to sixth potency. Locally, the tincture for ganglia and as a lotion for the eyes.
